claim.text: A typical homeowner owns $5,000–$10,000 in tools used fewer than ten times each

The statistic about underused homeowner tools is commonly cited in sharing economy contexts, but the specific dollar range and usage frequency cannot be confirmed without access to original research or surveys.

claim.text: most tools spend 99% of their life in storage
claim.claim: Most tools spend 99% of their life in storage

results.summary: Unable to verify due to lack of web search access; this is a commonly repeated claim in sharing economy discussions but its original source is unclear.
results.detail: This statistic is frequently cited in sharing economy and tool library advocacy materials, but I cannot search for the primary source without web access. The 99% figure may be an approximation or rhetorical device rather than a rigorously measured statistic. Similar claims have been made about cars (used only 4-5% of the time) with better documentation.
